content.question: Which of the following statements best describes how organisms such as rabbits obtain the carbon necessary for building biological molecules?

choices.label: Rabbits eat plants and use energy absorbed from the plants to make carbon atoms from electrons, protons, and neutrons in the air.
Rabbits eat plants and break down plant molecules to obtain carbon and other atoms that they rearrange into new carbon-containing molecules.

Rabbits eat plants and use water absorbed from the plants to hydrolyze <math alttext="C O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>2</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, which the rabbits breathe in from the air and use as a carbon source.
Rabbits eat plants and make carbon-containing molecules by using carbon atoms that the plants absorbed from the soil and stored in the cells of their leaves.

content.answer: Rabbits eat plants and break down plant molecules to obtain carbon and other atoms that they rearrange into new carbon-containing molecules.

skill.text: 2.A: Describe characteristics of visual representations of biological concepts and processes.
